bill.title: Salvage certificates of title; revise laws regarding.
bill.description: An Act To Require That When An Insurance Company Makes A Total Loss Settlement On A Motor Vehicle, The Owner Or Lienholder Of The Vehicle Shall Forward The Certificate Of Title To The Insurance Company Within Fifteen Days After Receipt Of The Settlement Funds; To Allow The Insurance Company To Request A Salvage Certificate Of Title When Unable To Obtain The Certificate Of Title Within Thirty Days After Disbursement Of Total Loss Settlement Funds; To Require The Mississippi Insurance Department To Issue A Salvage Certificate Of Title When Receiving Certain Certificates Of Title Or Certain Requests For A Salvage Certificate Of Title; To Bring Forward Section 63-21-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Pertains To Salvage Certificates Of Title, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.
